history.content: I have not taken 169 (nor will I), but I'm currently taking 162, and, IMHO, this course is a must for all software engineers who expect to do at least a little bit of backend work at some point. I find the topics covered in the class very important and fundamental to understanding of the systems, and the class is kind of a continuation of 61C. Also, heavy project workload pushes you to understand a somewhat complex code written by other people and contributing to it, which is a useful skill as well.

children.subject: I'd like to think that 169 is what you'd be doing anyway for many years in industry, so take 162 for the reasons above.

history.content: For my last semester at Berkeley, I was planning to take 186 and either 162 or 169. Which of these courses would be a more practical/useful experience? Is CS162 still a critical course for CS students to take?
history.subject: 162 vs 169
